wiki.content:
"Bitches Brew" 
 
 Recorded Columbia Studio B, New York City August 19, 1969
 
     Miles Davis - trumpet
     Wayne Shorter - soprano saxophone
     Bennie Maupin - bass clarinet
     Joe Zawinul - electric piano - Left
     Chick Corea - electric piano - Right
     John McLaughlin - electric guitar
     Dave Holland - bass
     Harvey Brooks - electric bass
     Lenny White - drum set - Left
     Jack DeJohnette - drum set - Right
     Don Alias - congas
     Juma Santos (credited as "Jim Riley") - shaker, congas
 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary:
"Bitches Brew"   Recorded Columbia Studio B, New York City August 19, 1969      Miles Davis - trumpet
     Wayne Shorter - soprano saxophone
     Bennie Maupin - bass clarinet
     Joe Zawinul - electric piano - Left
     Chick Corea - electric piano - Right
     John McLaughlin - electric guitar
     Dave Holland - bass
     Harvey Brooks - electric bass
     Lenny White - drum set - Left
     Jack DeJohnette - drum set - Right
     Don Alias - congas

name: Bitches Brew
comments: so good. this piece has aged incredibly well. i think it sounds amazing. and if it's available on itunes, amazon or elsewhere for 99 cents with that line-up and a length of 26+ minutes, it has to be the best value ever. as if that really had anything to do with it...
Jazz, funk, soul, rock'n'roll. Seriously cool.
This is some strange shit,but that what makes it so good
Each time the trumpet strikes, I feel like a set of lasers are blasting through my brains.
12:49 ? that's not even half the song
why do I like this so much?   makes me feel the great mysteries circa the Divine universe?  i grok this...
Fucking cool song, man. For serious.
DAVE HOLLAND RUNS DUH BASS DOOOWWWWNNNNNNN
fucking right.

Miles Davis,trumpet   Wayne Shorter,soprano saxophone                    Bennie Maupin, bass clarinet   Joe Zawinul, electric piano - Left           Chick Corea, electric piano - Right   John McLaughlin, electric guitar   Dave Holland, bass   Harvey Brooks, electric bass                               Lenny White, drum set - Left   Jack DeJohnette, drum set - Right          Don Alias, congas    Juma Santos (credited as "Jim Riley"),shaker, congas
Thanks to FanOmas for the credits
What a sound!!!!!!
What a line up!!!!!

On "Spanish Key","Pharaoh's Dance":

Miles Davis - trumpet
Wayne Shorter - soprano saxophone
Bennie Maupin - bass clarinet
Joe Zawinul - electric piano - Left
Larry Young - electric piano - Center
Chick Corea - electric piano - Right
John McLaughlin - electric guitar
Dave Holland - bass
Harvey Brooks - electric bass
Lenny White - drum set - Left
Jack DeJohnette - drum set - Right
Don Alias - Congas
Juma Santos (credited as "Jim Riley") - Shaker

On "Miles Runs the Voodoo Down": 

Miles Davis - trumpet
Wayne Shorter - soprano saxophone
Bennie Maupin - bass clarinet
Joe Zawinul - electric piano - Left
Chick Corea - electric piano - Right
John McLaughlin - electric guitar
Dave Holland - electric bass
Harvey Brooks - electric bass
Don Alias - drum set - Left
Jack DeJohnette - drum set - Right
Juma Santos (credited as "Jim Riley") - congas

Musicians on "Bitches Brew", "John McLaughlin", "Sanctuary": 

Miles Davis - trumpet
Wayne Shorter - soprano saxophone
Bennie Maupin - bass clarinet
Joe Zawinul - electric piano - Left
Chick Corea - electric piano - Right
John McLaughlin - electric guitar
Dave Holland - bass
Harvey Brooks - electric bass
Lenny White - drum set - Left
Jack DeJohnette - drum set - Right
Don Alias - congas
Juma Santos (credited as "Jim Riley") - shaker, congas
Anyone who can give the line up?   I do't have my L.P. any more.
Wonderful brilliance by the funk masters on percussion, Fender Rhodes and bass...must be Herbie
Tight as a gnat's arse. Go Miles!

Always loved it. It's jazz. Call it Bitches Brew or whatever. By any other name it would sound as sweet. The great, inventive, innovative Miles at his wah wah best with electronic funk and echo.....superb mastery.
I used to hate this on first listen, but now that i actually understand it i absolutely love Bitches Brew. (2)
